title: Electric Vehicles (EVs): Who’s Leading the Charge and What’s the Trending?
text: Welcome to my first Quarto blog post! In this post, we’ll explore the global trends in electric vehicle (EV) adoption and see which regions are driving the shift to cleaner transportation.

title: Electric Vehicles (EVs): Who’s Leading the Charge and What’s the Trending?
text:
Data Source:
To get a comprehensive view of global EV sales, we used data from the website,tracking sales by region and vehicle type. The dataset includes actual sales data from 2010 to 2024 and forecasted data up to 2035, providing a detailed picture of both historical and predicted trends. To simplify the analysis, we grouped individual countries into broader regions like North America and Europe. Predicted sales were flagged separately for easy distinction.

title: Electric Vehicles (EVs): Who’s Leading the Charge and What’s the Trending?
text:
Variables in the Dataset
The dataset includes several variables that track EV sales across different regions and vehicle types:

Year: Year of EV sales.
Category: Historical vs predicted sales figures.
Paramater: include 4 categories: EV sales,EV sales share,EV stock,EV stock share.
Region: Countries where sales occurred.
Powertrain: Type of electric vehicle (BEV, PHEV, FCEV).
Value: Number of sales sold in a given year and region.

EV Sales Have Soared Since 2010
This stacked bar chart Figure 1 illustrates how different regions are contributing to the global rise of EVs.It also shows the rise of EV sales globally from 2010 to 2024, with predictions through 2035. The data highlights a significant increase in EV sales since 2018, driven largely by growing government incentives and technological advancements.The reduced opacity in the chart represents predicted sales, showing that this trend is expected to continue upward for the next decade.

title: Electric Vehicles (EVs): Who’s Leading the Charge and What’s the Trending?
text:
The Dominance of BEVs
When we look at global EV sales by powertrain type, it’s clear that Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) are the favorite. BEVs account for a whopping 81.3% of all EV sales worldwide, while Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEVs) make up 17.9%, and Fuel Cell Electric Vehicles (FCEVs) are at a distant 0.8%.








Figure 2: Worldwide Distribution of EV Sales by Powertrain Type





Figure 2 shows that shows that BEVs are the most popular choice across the globe. The strong market preference for BEVs is driven by improvements in battery technology, lower costs, and better range.

title: Electric Vehicles (EVs): Who’s Leading the Charge and What’s the Trending?
text:
Regional Differences in Powertrain Preferences
Although BEVs dominate globally, regional preferences vary. Figure 3 shows the EV sales share by region and powertrain type. For example, PHEVs have a larger presence in Europe and South America compared to other regions, while FCEVs struggle to gain traction anywhere.It also highlights how different regions favor different types of EVs. China and North America have an overwhelming preference for BEVs, while Europe and South America also show interest in PHEVs.
